section.p: You lash out, knocking the dwarf to the ground. As he sits cradling his head, you hurry over to the figure on horseback. As you lift the visor, a wisp of green smoke curls out and you hear a voice say: ‘I thank you, mortal, for my freedom.’
The smoke disperses on the breeze: the armour is empty.
Get the codewords Bosky and Baluster. You can also take and a , since the dwarf is in no fit state to stop you.
